110.title: The Boondocks

110.series: July 20, 1999) "Isn't That Why We Pay Property Tax?"*

111.title: The Boondocks
111.author: Aaron McGruder.
111.series: July 21, 1999) "A Printout of Child Labor Laws?"*

112.title: The Boondocks
112.author: Aaron McGruder.
112.series: July 22, 1999) "So Is It Swing Low, Sweet Chariot?"*
notes: Summary: Huey's going to mow the lawn, and asks Granddad about appropriate slave songs to sing.

113.title: The Boondocks
113.author: Aaron McGruder.
113.series: July 24, 1999) "Shut Up and Mow the Lawn, Boy! And Who's Garry Trudeau?"*
notes: Summary: Nike was in trouble with Garry Trudeau for working conditions like this.

114.title: The Boondocks
114.author: Aaron McGruder.
114.series: July 27, 1999) "In a Few Days, We Gotta Do It All Over Again!"*
notes: Summary: Huey explains lawnmowing as pushing the deathtrap through the heat and insects, and then gets to the really sick part.

115.title: The Boondocks
115.author: Aaron McGruder.
115.series: July 28, 1999) "Instead of Cutting the Grass Every Week, Let's Just Burn It!"*

116.title: The Boondocks
116.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Grandpa hears the boys singing spirituals and freedom songs as they do their yard work.

117.title: The Boondocks
117.author: Aaron McGruder.
117.series: July 31, 1999) "We've Turned It Into Something Mundane"*
notes: Summary: Huey says mowing the lawn was terrible, like cutting his hair would be.

118.title: The Boondocks
118.author: by Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Huey plans to drink tea, read Thoreau and watch the golf channel until supper.

119.title: The Boondocks
119.author: Aaron McGruder.
119.series: Sept. 13, 1999) "Forgetting to Mention Something, Nubian Princess?"*
notes: Summary: Jazmine introduces herself to the class at J. Edgar Hoover Elementary, and Huey thinks she should say she's Black.

120.title: The Boondocks
120.author: by Aaron McGruder.
120.series: Feb. 3, 2000) "What About Whitney Houston's Thirty- and Forty-Year-Old Fans?"*
notes: Summary: Grampa is seventy and knows right from wrong, but he worries that young folks might get the wrong impression when their favorite singer is involved with drugs.

121.title: The Boondocks
121.author: by Aaron McGruder.
121.series: Feb. 4, 2000) "I Pray One of them Learns How to Just Say No"*
notes: Summary: Huey is asked about Whitney Houston and drugs, and whether he thinks she'll be working with Dre and Snoop.

122.title: The Boondocks
122.author: Aaron McGruder.
122.series: Feb. 5, 2000) "Whether or not any of these People Actually Should be Employed is Obviously Another Question"*
notes: Sumary: Live from L.A., on B.E.T., "employs more Black writers, producers, actors and directors than any other show in Hollywood."

123.title: The Boondocks
123.author: Aaron McGruder.
123.series: Feb. 9, 2000) "Did You Know a Black Man Invented Peanut Butter?"*
notes: Summary: Petto thinks he can't teach Black history, and that Huey's a communist; another teacher gives him a copy of Black History for White Folks, by Henry Louis Gates, Jr.

124.title: The Boondocks
124.author: Aaron McGruder.
124.series: Feb. 10, 2000) "By Any Chance, Are You Referring to the Black Peanuts Character?"*
notes: Summary: Huey's teacher, Mr. Petto, introduces Black History Month by saying they'll study Harriet Tubman and Franklin Douglass.

125.title: The Boondocks
125.author: Aaron McGruder.
125.series: July 6, 2000) "Didn't I Tell You to Cut the Grass?"*
notes: Summary: Huey turns up with Granddad on his census job, and Granddad is not pleased to see him.

126.title: The Boondocks
126.author: by Aaron McGruder.
126.series: Aug. 4, 2000) "Did I Mention I May Be Suffering from Clinical Procrastination?"*
notes: Huey gave Riley the census job, then rushed back to mow the lawn like he was supposed to, though he hasn't actually done it yet.

127.title: The Boondocks
127.author: Aaron McGruder.
127.series: Aug. 14, 2000) "Darned Shame What He Did To That L'il White Girl"*
notes: Summary: Grandpa doesn't want Riley using the lawnmower, because of something that happened with a weed whacker last Summer.

128.title: The Boondocks
128.author: Aaron McGruder.
128.series: Aug. 15, 2000) "I Believe It's Wrong to Impose Assimilation on Any Living Thing, Even Grass"*
notes: Summary: Huey explains his political reasons for not mowing the lawn, but Granddad takes off his belt and Huey decides not to continue the explanation.

129.title: The Boondocks
129.author: by Aaron McGruder.
129.series: Aug. 16, 2000) "I'm Seeing Myself Cut the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Huey tries using positive visualization on the lawn.

130.title: The Boondocks
130.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Huey addresses the lawnmowing problem by reading a book on procrastination.

131.title: The Boondocks
131.author: Aaron McGruder.
131.series: Aug. 18, 2000) "But Don't Think I Won't Do It!"*
notes: Summary: Granddad says if he has to mow the lawn himself he'll have a stroke and die and then he'll have to kill Huey, not necessarily in that order.
Redistributed on July 21, 2006.

132.title: The Boondocks
132.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Riley tries to give Huey some moral support with his lawnmowing problem, so they can go see The Klumps.

133.title: The Boondocks
133.author: A
133.series: Aug. 22, 2000) "That's It! No More Procrastination! I'm Getting Up and Cutting This Grass"*
notes: Summary: Time for focus and discipline.

134.title: The Boondocks
134.author: Aaron McGruder.
134.series: Aug. 23, 2000) "Would You Like To Play House With Me?"*
notes: Summary: Huey ruminates about reasons not to mow the lawn (he's against "curtailing the progress of nature for aesthetic reasons") but he forgets all that when he gets a worse offer.

135.title: The Boondocks
135.author: Aaron McGruder.
135.series: Aug. 24, 2000) "But If I Manage to Make Contact with the Underground Railroad, I'm Outta Here"*
notes: Summary: Huey has finally started mowing the lawn.

136.title: The Boondocks
136.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Huey has apparently passed out while mowing the lawn. He wakes up and closes his eyes again.

137.title: The Boondocks
137.author: Aaron McGruder.
137.series: Aug. 29, 2000) "This Yard Has as Much a Right to Grow as My Own Hair!"*
notes: Summary: The lawn is mowed, but Huey feels bad about it.

138.title: The Boondocks
138.author: Aaron McGruder.
138.series: Sept. 23, 2000) "Man, Bush Couldn't Even Lead His Running Mate to the Voting Booth"*
notes: Summary: Huey points out that Cheney didn't vote for Bush in the primary.

139.title: The Boondocks
139.author: by Aaron McGruder.
139.series: Sept. 25, 2000) "A Big Ol' Nasty, Hairy, Yet Strangely Boring Rat"*
notes: Summary: Grandpa can't help thinking of Al Gore as a rat.

140.title: The Boondocks
140.author: Aaron McGruder.
140.series: Oct. 5, 2000) "If You or I were That Dumb and Running for President, Would Anyone Let Up on Us?"*
notes: Summary: Thoughts about the campaign coverage of George W. Bush.

141.title: The Boondocks
141.author: by Aaron McGruder.
141.series: Oct. 6, 2000) "A Hard Time Coming Up with a Front-Page Story on the Election"*
notes: Summary: The idea of switching to a Jennifer Lopez story doesn't seem right either.

142.title: The Boondocks
142.author: Aaron McGruder.
142.series: Oct. 7, 2000) "Seriously, When Jennifer Lopez Dumps Puffy, You Think I'll Have a Chance?"*

143.title: The Boondocks
143.author: by Aaron McGruder.
143.series: Nov. 9, 2000) "Stop Foolin' Around and Tell Me Who Won?!"*
notes: Summary: Tom Dubois asks Huey who won the presidential election, and Huey tells him it wasn't Ralph Nader.

144.title: The Boondocks
144.author: by Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Mr. Dubois got to arguing with his wife about Ralph Nader, and he called her names, and she beat him up and threw him out.

145.title: The Boondocks
145.author: by Aaron McGruder.
145.series: May 21, 2001) "A Cold, Indigestion, Depression, Terminal Cancer.. Haven't Done the Research Yet"*
notes: Summary: Huey doesn't feel well.

146.title: The Boondocks
146.author: Aaron McGruder.
146.series: May 28, 2001) "Good Talk, Granddad. Have Fun with the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Granddad tries to suggest that Huey should mow the lawn.
Strip re-distributed for May 28, 2001.

147.title: The Boondocks
147.author: Aaron McGruder.
147.series: May 30, 2001) "A Printout of Child Labor Laws?"*
notes: Summary: Huey is asked to mow the lawn and responds in his own way.
Redistributed for May 30, 2001.

148.title: The Boondocks
148.author: Aaron McGruder.
148.series: July 12, 2001) "I Think Your Granddad May Be Onto Something With This Whole 'Lawn Care' Thing"*
notes: Summary: They're trying to play soccer in the yard, but the grass is so tall they can't see the ball.

149.title: The Boondocks
149.author: by Aaron McGruder.
149.series: Sept. 21, 2001) "How the Heck Can You Tell When He's 'Kinda' Upset?"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Freeman is looking for Huey, who has been kind of upset.

150.title: The Boondocks
150.author: by Aaron McGruder.
150.series: Sept. 24, 2001) "It's So Hard to Laugh, or Smile, or be Funny"*
notes: Although of course Huey has never done any of those things.
Strip in response to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes.

151.title: The Boondocks
151.author: by Aaron McGruder.
151.series: Sept. 25, 2001) "I For One Think President Giuliani did a Wonderful Job During the First Few Days of the..."*
notes: Summary: Huey listens to the television tell him to have faith in government leaders.
Strip in response to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes.

152.title: The Boondocks
152.author: by Aaron McGruder.
152.series: Sept. 26, 2001) "Ongoing Coverage of 'America Strikes Back' is Brought to You By..."*
notes: Summary: Nike and McDonalds are the sponsors.

153.title: The Boondocks
153.author: by Aaron McGruder.
153.series: Sept. 27, 2001) "America Stops and Thinks About Why Some People Hate Us?"*
notes: Summary: Huey comments on the logos the news channels are using for coverage of the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes.

154.title: The Boondocks
154.author: by Aaron McGruder.
154.series: Sept. 28, 2001) "America is All About Blind, Unquestioning Faith in our Almost-Elected Leaders"*
notes: Summary: Another former critic of the president weighs in on television. Strip in response to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes.

155.title: The Boondocks
155.author: Aaron McGruder.
155.series: Sept. 29, 2001) "Sorry for Wasting Everyone's Time with Months of Worthless Gary Condit Stuff"*
notes: Summary: A television news channel expresses its new perspective after the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes.

156.title: The Boondocks
156.author: by Aaron McGruder.
156.series: Oct. 1, 2001) "I'm Going to Stay Cynical, Resist This Bandwagon War Mentality"*
notes: Huey holds his ground.
Strip in response to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes.

157.title: The Boondocks
157.author: Aaron McGruder.
157.series: Oct. 2, 2001) "I Am Writing to Expess My Deep Gratitude for Your Courage in your Lone Stance Against Bush's Warmongering"*
notes: Summary: Huey writes a letter to Congresswoman Lee.

158.title: The Boondocks
158.author: Aaron McGruder.
158.series: Oct. 3, 2001) "We've Been Tapping Your Phone For Years"*
notes: Summary: Huey calls the anonymous terrorism tip line, and the FBI knows who's calling.

159.title: The Boondocks
159.author: Aaron McGruder.
159.series: Oct. 4, 2001) "Huey Calls the FBI's Terrorism Tip Line"
notes: Summary: Huey knows who helped train Osama Bin Laden, and his list starts with Ronald Reagan.

160.title: The Boondocks
160.author: Aaron McGruder.
160.series: Oct. 5, 2001) "Huey Squeals to the Feds' Terrorism Hotine"
notes: Summary: The CIA trained Osama Bin Laden.

161.title: The Boondocks
161.author: Aaron McGruder.
161.series: Oct. 6, 2001) "Huey Helps the FBI Wage War on Terrorism!"
notes: Summary: U.S. government gave Taliban $43 million in May 2001.

162.title: The Boondocks
162.author: by Aaron McGruder.
162.series: Oct. 9, 2001) "I'm Going to Remind You of This Conversation When We're Exiled to Cuba"*
notes: Summary: The President said to get back to normal, and normal for Huey is to be criticizing the President. Caesar is not thrilled.

163.title: The Boondocks
163.author: by Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Huey listens to the attorney general's plan to electronically bug suspected terrorists while protecting the rights of Arab and Muslim Americans.

164.title: The Boondocks
164.author: Aaron McGruder.
164.series: Aug. 9, 2003) "He Thought It Meant Library in Spanish"*
notes: Summary: President Bush avoided Liberia on his trip.

165.title: The Boondocks
165.author: A
165.series: Aug. 30, 2003) "Mike Tyson Went Broke and They're Selling His Stuff on Ebay"*

166.title: The Boondocks
166.author: by Aaron McGruder.
166.series: May 24, 2004) "Freeman Family 'moveon.org' Commercial Submission Take One"*

167.title: The Boondocks
167.author: by Aaron McGruder.
167.series: June 1, 2004) "For the Record, I Do Feel Guilty when the President's Disastrous Foreign Policies Accidentally Benefit Me Personally"*
notes: Summary: The lawnmower's out of gas.

168.title: The Boondocks
168.author: Aaron McGruder.
168.series: July 3, 2004) "You're Too Much of a Punk Democrat"*
notes: Summary: Ralph Nader wasn't worried that his abductor would hurt him.

169.title: The Boondocks
169.author: Aaron McGruder.
169.series: July 5, 2004) "Wait, I Feel a Great Disturbance in the Force"*
notes: Summary: Strip about Saddam Hussein, chemical weapons, Ronald Reagan, Donald Rumsfeld and Iraq in 1984.

170.title: The Boondocks
170.author: Aaron McGruder.
170.series: July 8, 2004) "Rumsfeld Says They're Cutting Back Chemical Weapons Sales to Iraq by 15 Percent"*
notes: Summary: about Saddam Hussein, Iran, Reagan, sanctions and consequences.
Takes place in 1984.

171.title: The Boondocks
171.author: Aaron McGruder.
171.series: July 10, 2004) "I'm Gonna Burn Your Bloom County Books If You Don't Let Me Sleep"*
notes: Summary: About Saddam Hussein, Iraq, the C.I.A., Reagan, Bush, and Rumsfeld, from a 1984 perspective.

172.title: The Boondocks
172.author: Aaron McGruder.
172.series: May 19, 2005) "Granddad, an Earring in Your Right Ear Could Be Considered a Sign That You're Gay"*
notes: Summary: Granddad wants to know about rappers and their earrings.

173.title: The Boondocks
173.author: by Aaron McGruder.
173.series: Apr. 14, 2006) "The Blacks Have Moved In! Have You Seen Any Yet?"*
notes: Summary: Cindy asks Jazmine to be her best friend.
Copyright 1999.

174.title: The Boondocks
174.author: by Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: She's an NAACP lawyer, a champion of civil rights, she can't be in the Ku Klux Klan.
Copyright 1999.

175.title: The Boondocks
175.author: Aaron McGruder.
175.series: July 21, 2006) "But Don't Think I Won't Do It!"*
notes: Summary: Granddad says if he has to mow the lawn himself he'll have a stroke and die and then he'll have to kill Huey, not necessarily in that order.
Redistributed on July 21, 2006.

176.heading: The Boondocks--Articles About.
176.title: "Huey Freeman, American Hero"
176.author: by John Nichols
176.appears_in: p. 11-13 in The Nation, v. 274, no. 3 (Jan. 28, 2002).
notes: "Sure, he's a cartoon character, but it still takes courage to speak out."
Article on Aaron McGruder's comic strip, The Boondocks.

177.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
177.title: "Attack Aftermath Finds Its Way Into the Funny Pages"
177.author: by Raoul V
177.appears_in: Mowatt. section 5, p. 1, 7 in Chicago Tribune, Sept. 26, 2001.
notes: Aaron McGruder, Scott Adams, Brian Walker, Bill Amend, Garry Trudeau, Mort Walker, Michael Kilian, Tom Batiuk, and Nicole Hollander talk about mentioning or not mentioning the terrorist actions of Sept. 11, 2001 in their respective strips. One example of The Boondocks is shown.

178.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
178.title: "The Boondocks" p. 56-63 in Cartoonist Profiles, no. 123
178.author: [No author]
notes: Interview with Aaron McGruder, with photographs of McGruder and samples of the strip.

179.title: "Boondocks Cartoon ReSurfaces, So Does Newspaper Outcry" p. 40 in The Comics Journal, no. 264
179.author: [No author]
notes: (Newswatch : Journal Datebook)

180.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
180.title: "The Boondocks Debate Continues" sect. 5, p. 1 and 8 in The Chicago Tribune, June 4, 1999. Letters to the editor on racism, Aaron McGruder and Boondocks, from Lamont Thompson, Patrick Judycki, Gary Grant, Morris E. Robinson Jr., Rich Strohbeck, T. Diane Slatton, Larry Adkison, Michael L. Johnson, Andrew Kupczak, and Regina Tholmer.
180.author: [No author]

notes: Letter to the editor.

183.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
183.title: "Cartoonist's Work is Socially Relevant"
183.author: Jeremy Magruder
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks and Aaron McGruder.

184.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
184.title: "Changing Comics is a Serious Matter : The Boondocks" p. 2B in The Lansing State Journal, Feb. 5, 2005.
184.author: [No author]
notes: Introduces the strip scheduled to join the comics page on February 14.

185.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
185.title: "The Color of Funny : Boondocks Creator takes on Critics of his Focus on Race"
185.author: by Charles Leroux
185.appears_in: Sect. 5, p. 1, 5 in the Chicago Tribune, May 26, 1999.
notes: Newspaper story on Aaron McGruder, with photographs of the cartoonist.

186.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
186.title: "Comic Not Funny, Just Bashes Race"
186.author: Angela Neumann
186.appears_in: p. 4A in The State News, Nov. 19, 2001.
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks.

187.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
187.title: "Comic Relief"
187.author: Diane Siracusa
187.appears_in: section 1, p. 24 in The Chicago Tribune, Oct. 24, 2002.
notes: Letter to the editor about the comic strip Boondocks.

188.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
188.title: "Comic Strip Mocks Absurdity, Not Race"
188.author: Cedrick Heraux
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks.

189.heading: Boondocks--Miscellanea.
189.title: "Comics Changes : Get Fuzzy, Boondocks are Among LSJ Additions"
189.author: by Tim Makinen
189.appears_in: p. 1D in the Lansing State Journal, Jan. 27, 2005.
notes: Announces new daily strips Frazz, Get Fuzzy, The Boondocks, Rose is Rose, Pickles, Red and Rover, and Brevity, and the discontinuing of Born Loser, Cathy, Classic Peanuts, Dennis the Menace, Hagar the Horrible, Marvin, and Rex Morgan M.D.

190.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
190.title: "Comic's Point"
190.author: Paul Roeder
190.appears_in: Section 1, p. 20 in The Chicago Tribune, July 23, 2003.
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks, Strom Thurmond, Martin Luther King Jr., and Medgar Evers.

191.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
191.title: "A Couple Chidings and Some New Lang Syne : The Year in Review"
191.author: by R
191.appears_in: C. Harvey. p. 75-82 in The Comics Journal, no. 250 (Feb. 2003).
notes: (2002, the Year in Review)
(Comicopia)

Essay covers magazine cartooning, editorial cartooning, and newspaper strips, with sections on The Boondocks, Mallard Fillmore and Doonesbury, La Cucaracha, Tina's Groove, Pearls Before Swine, Out of the Gene Pool, and Zippy.

192.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
192.title: "Disgusting Comic"
192.author: John Martini
192.appears_in: section 1, p. 24 in The Chicago Tribune, Oct. 24, 2002.
notes: Letter to the editor about the comic strip Boondocks.

193.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
193.title: "Drop Boondocks"
193.author: Tom LaMay
193.appears_in: p. 12A in The Detroit News, Apr. 27, 2001.
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks.

194.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
194.title: "Found It Depressing"
194.author: C
194.appears_in: Kaspar. sect. 5, p. 2 in The Chicago Tribune (July 1, 1999).
notes: Letter to the editor on the comic strip, "The Boondocks."

195.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
195.title: "Free Speech for Funnies"
195.author: Jean Barnard
notes: Letter to the editor about the Boondocks comic strip.

196.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
196.title: "Give Comic Relief"
196.author: Richard W
196.appears_in: O'Bryan. p. 10A in The Detroit News (Aug. 11, 1999).
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks.

197.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
197.title: "Humor Choices"
197.author: Richard M
197.appears_in: Eastman. p. 18, sect. 1 in The Chicago Tribune (Sept. 17, 1999).
notes: Letter to the editor about The Dinette Set, The Lockhorns, and The Boondocks.

198.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
198.title: "Inappropriate Comic"
198.author: Carol Rakow
198.appears_in: p. 21, sect. 1 in The Chicago Tribune, Feb. 12, 2000.
notes: Letter to the editor on the comic strip Boondocks.

199.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
199.title: "Kill Boondocks"
199.author: Irene Finn
notes: Letter to the editor about the Boondocks comic strip.

200.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
200.title: "Lacking Humor"
200.author: Michael Gebert
200.appears_in: section 1, p. 24 in The Chicago Tribune, Oct. 24, 2002.
notes: Letter to the editor about the comic strip Boondocks.

201.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
201.title: "New Cartoon Not Overtly Offensive"
201.author: John Takis
notes: Letter to the editor about The Boondocks and Aaron McGruder.

202.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
202.title: "News & Notes"
202.author: by R

notes: Items on Mad, the Reuben awards, editorial cartoonists, The Boondocks, etc.

203.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
203.title: "Newspaper Comic Strip Will Become a New Show" p. E-1 in The Detroit News, Sept. 21, 2004.
203.author: [No author]
notes: News item on The Boondocks.

204.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
204.title: "Race to the Finish"
204.author: Tom Heintjes on comic strips
204.appears_in: p. 17-18 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 3 (=no. 7) (1999).
notes: (Radio Free Hogan' Alley)
Column on Aaron McGruder's strip, The Boondocks.

205.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
205.title: "Rating Comics"
205.author: Leon Greenberg
205.appears_in: Section 1, p. 18 in The Chicago Tribune, Aug. 5, 2003.
notes: Letter to the editor commenting on Dilbert, The Boondocks, Doonesbury, Peanuts, Baby Blues, For Better or For Worse, Zits, Mutts, Mister Boffo, Cathy, Blondie, Dick Tracy, Brenda Starr, and Get Fuzzy.

206.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
206.title: "Why Apologize for Pointing Out the Truth?"
206.author: Ted Z Manuel
206.appears_in: section 1, p. 24 in The Chicago Tribune, Oct. 24, 2002.
notes: Letter to the editor about the comic strip Boondocks.

207.heading: The Boondocks--Miscellanea.
207.author: [No author]
notes: (Newswatch : Journal Datebook)

208.heading: The Boondocks--Reviews.
208.title: "Ground-Zero Newspaper Strip: The Boondocks in 2001"
208.author: by Dan Holloway
208.appears_in: p. 47-48 in The Comics Journal, no. 240 (Jan. 2002).
notes: (Year in Review)
Reviews the Aaron McGruder strip.

209.heading: The Boondocks--Reviews.
209.title: "Peut-on Dessiner après le 11 Septembre?"
209.author: Harry Morgan
209.appears_in: p. 108-109 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (Oct. 2003).
notes: (Comptes Rendus)

Reviews three American collections of comics particularly in light of their reactions to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist attacks: Putain, c'est la guerre=Get Your War On (David Rees) ; Boondocks: Parce que je sais (Aaron McGruder) ; and Attitude: the New Subversive Political Cartoonists (ed. by Ted Rall).

210.title: "Boondocks Cartoon ReSurfaces, So Does Newspaper Outcry" p. 40 in The Comics Journal, no. 264

notes: (Newswatch : Journal Datebook)

211.author: Brett J

notes: Letter to the editor on the comic strip Boondocks.

212.title: "Boondocks Fan"
212.author: Jamie Lee Silver
212.appears_in: sect. 1, p. 16 in The Chicago Tribune (Apr. 14, 2003).
notes: Letter to the editor.

213.author: [No author]
notes: Began with no. 1 (Mar. 1995).
By Steve Stegelin.
